msg: @Peace 離開了頻道 [translated by :google:]
looks like I broke the bridge again :joy:
hello?

@caasi oh! broke the bridge? how so? (#general no longer receives translated messages, but rather, it receives all the untranslated messages from elsewhere. The hope was to have a minimally intrusive channel where the translator can "get out of the way" when people already speak english/chinese/etc.)
Visiting #general-tw has every messages translated into chinese. totally open to feedback on that choice!
すごいーみんな日本語喋ってる
@patcon I broke my IRC bridge. :joy: Now it’s fixed.
love the current decision. It keeps #general clean. @patcon++ “minimally intrusive”++
@au @fchin :+1: re: link to original message. @caasi raise a similar point.
Oh wow, I didn't realize that app message could have markdown-like links in them! But I see here that it can:
https://api.slack.com/docs/messages/builder?msg=%7B%22text%22%3A%22So%20does%20this%20one%3A%20%3Chttps%3A%2F%2Fwww.foo.com%7Ctesting%3E.%22%7D
ok, this is doable, I think
slackbot4's url: [Message Formatting | Slack]
@caasi :heart:

The one downside is that it won't be quite as evident to newcomvers that this channel's conversations are for them -- they will probably first assume that everyone simply speaks a bunch of languages and understands one another :wink: But we can figure out the most newcomer-friendly thing later!
